items.title: Add support for 'GET [resource]/new' and 'GET [resource]/edit' routes to Resource
items.body: This is the revival of #741. As work has started on Vapor 2.0, I think it's time to review these changes.

items.title: Log routes
items.body:
If you have:

```swift
let drop = try Droplet(arguments: ["vapor", "routes"])
drop.get("foo") { _ in return "" }
drop.put("foo/bar/:id") { _ in return "" }
```

You get:

```
+------+--------+--------------+
| Host | Method | Path         | 
+------+--------+--------------+
| *    | GET    | /foo         |
|      | PUT    | /foo/bar/:id |
+------+--------+--------------+
```

Also can use from cli

```
vapor run routes
```
or
```
.build/debug/App routes
```

items.title: data returns easier to use node type
fix localization dependent on unordered order
make manual configurations easier by allowing custom load
sockets
items.body:
- add `SecurityLayer` here
- add new `EngineClient` and `EngineServer`

Waiting on https://github.com/vapor/engine/pull/115

items.title: Extend CacheProtocol and CacheSessions with expiration time (for Vapor 2)
items.body:
This PR is practically the same as #906 (which I'll close in a second), but applied on top of master instead of the 1.x versions.

The rationale is still in #907.

items.title: allow providers to include resources
items.body: Mostly explicit view support right now, some setup around general resourcing

items.title: slight error response cleanup
items.body:
I noticed nothing in here actually threw, then ended up with some clean up. I think a few of these might be worth porting into Node for this type of stuff, namely the rethrow closure so you can do `set("foo", thing.makeNode)` and it only requires try on throwing implementation.

For now it's all additive, so file private here to prevent an impossible code path :+1:

items.title: adding skyliner to list of deployment options
items.body: Hey folks, I added special support to [Skyliner](https://www.skyliner.io) for shipping Vapor projects to AWS. I was hoping to get that added to the readme.

items.title: added local paramter name
items.body:
## Things done: 
- [X] Added local parameter name in protocol declaration. This gives nice autocomplete with bit more context. 

## Related Issue #851 

Thanks @LoganWright and @tanner0101 for the help.

items.title: Add missing public init to HeadMiddleware
items.body: As discussed on slack with @LoganWright in development

items.title: Add refreshCookieEveryRequest to AuthMiddleware
items.body:
If true, this allows the cookie factory to run every time so that with each request the expiration date can be reset. So, a short expiration date can be set like 10 minutes, but it will be 10 minutes from each successful auth request instead of just 10 minutes from the first login.

fyi: I incorrectly assumed that the `edit` button in GitHub would create a PR, instead it made the edits directly 😳: https://github.com/vapor/vapor/commit/b3abd80be444f34bc17c0765ae2ccb764ec4bd8a, I reverted this(https://github.com/vapor/vapor/commit/5a0191f924de3458b8398f85cfffb52ee7045bc5) and am submitting a PR for it, sorry 😔

items.title: simplify middleware
items.body:
Removes type safe error middleware by conforming type safe routing error to `AbortError`.

Removes unnecessary content type logger middleware.

Makes HTTP head conformance required.

items.title: Use JSONContext in Model.makeJSON instead of empty
items.body:
This change is a logical consequence of the default Database- and JSONContexts.

With this, both the custom makeJSON and the context-aware makeNode strategies can work out of the box.

items.title: cleanup error pages + view renderer
items.body:
- Simplified error page (less CPU heavy, vapor 2 gradient)
- Added `ErrorRenderer` for customizable error page rendering (more obvious solution than middleware)
- Added `addConfigurable` for view renderers and error renderers.
- Cleaned up the `ViewRenderer` protocol to abstract away `for: Provider.Type`

![screen shot 2017-04-10 at 7 04 49 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1342803/24874458/02a5c46c-1e25-11e7-9174-8c2295420898.png)

items.title: client factory
items.body:
- moves client convenience methods to `Responder`
- `ClientProtocol` -> `ClientFactory` to allow `drop.client` to be an instance type
- client conveniences now usable on `drop.client` and all other responders!
- removed old `providable` code
- additional vapor testing code

items.title: error middleware
items.body:
Moves to `ErrorMiddleware` for all error handling.

All non-handled errors will result in 500.
